title: Skyscanner soars to record revenues under Chinese ownership
text:
Skyscanner’s revenues have taken flight three years after the airline booking app was bought by the Chinese.

The Edinburgh-headquartered company saw revenues soar 21pc to a record £261m, according to accounts for its UK business.

Skyscanner lets users search across hundreds of flight-booking websites, as well as booking hotels and rentals.

The company, founded in 2001 by entrepreneur Gareth Williams, was one of the most successful Scottish start-ups of the early 2000s and had been hailed as a British success story before it was acquired by Chinese travel firm Ctrip in 2016 for £1.4bn,

Profits grew to £36m from around £19m the previous year, another new record for the company.

Last month, Skyscanner...
description: Skyscanner’s revenues have taken flight three years after the airline booking app was bought by the Chinese.
